It’s going to be a working vacation for Hillary Clinton.
The former secretary of state is taking some time off the campaign trail at the end of August to relax in the Hamptons, a tony vacation spot for New York’s elite, but she already has three campaign fundraisers on her schedule.
Story Continued Below
Clinton will host a luncheon at fashion designer and mogul Tory Burch’s Southampton home on Sunday, Aug. 30, according to an invite obtained by POLITICO.
Burch appears to be a first-time Clinton donor but has some connections in Clinton world. Terri McCullough, director of the Clinton Foundation’s “No Ceilings” project, previously worked at the Tory Burch Foundation. Burch has in the past made political contributions to Cory Booker’s Senate campaign and to New York Sen. Chuck Schumer.
A Burch spokeswoman did not respond to a request for comment.
Tickets to the Burch brunch cost $1,000 to attend, and $2,700 to attend and get a photograph with Clinton.
More on POLITICO
Clinton is also scheduled to attend a dinner reception on Saturday, Aug. 22, at the home of philanthropists Selma and Artie Rabin in Water Mill, and a pancake breakfast Aug. 30 hosted by longtime Clinton donors Susan and Alan Patricof at their East Hampton home, according to an invite obtained by POLITICO.
